page.title: 14St. Martins Church East End.
page.content: {St. Martins Church}is situated in East Woodhay. The exact date when built is unknown but there was a church built there in the 13th century and rebuilt in 1823 because it was in a dangerous state of repair.{The church}is 100 feet long And 45 feet wide.The tower is about 50 feet tall. It has 6 bells and 7 stained glass windows. In April 1912 a stained glass window was placed in the{church}dedicated to Bishop Ken. Bishop Ken was Rector of East Woodhay from 1669 to 1672. He planted the famous yew tree in the{church_yard, this has since died. The wood was used to make a cross and the stump is planted with flowers. The{church}plate was donated by the Goddards of Stargroves in 1697. The bells were made by John Corr, who had a bell foundry at Aldbourne in Wiltshire from 1728 to 1754.
